etymologies: modern Latin, named by Linnaeus after Joseph Kamel (Latinized as Camellus), Moravian botanist (1661–1706), who described the flora of Luzon

definitions: an evergreen eastern Asian shrub related to the tea plant, grown for its showy flowers and shiny leaves.

notes.text: Genus Camellia, family Theaceae: several species, in particular the common camellia (C. japonica), which has numerous cultivars and hybrids

shortDefinitions: evergreen East Asian shrub related to tea plant
